messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] favorite. samurai
messages.msgSnippet: ... Yamato is Japan, these days used rather more poetically, like Albion for England. The Yamato damashi is the Japanese spirit. Tony
messages.messageBody:
Francisco Manuel Luna Zapata wrote:

> hi every body i have question?
>
> what is the spirit of yamato damashi?
> what or who is yamato?
>

"Yamato" is Japan, these days used rather more poetically, like Albion for
England.

The "Yamato damashi" is the Japanese spirit.

Tony

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] favorite. samurai
messages.msgSnippet: kusunoki masashige, ashikaga takauji, yagyui munenori, mori motonari, i think there many great samurai.  really difficult to say someone was the best.  even
messages.messageBody:
kusunoki masashige, ashikaga takauji, yagyui munenori, mori motonari, i
think there many great samurai. really difficult to say someone was the
best. even yoritomo was great although it is quite unpopular view.

tim k
----Original Message Follows----
From: "vicente gutierrez" <alexelmaya@...>
Reply-To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
To: <samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com>
Subject: Re: [samuraihistory] favorite. samurai
Date: Fri, 9 Aug 2002 11:27:38 -0700

i say that oda nobungna was the best samurai who ever lived. tho he was
cruell, he was a master of deception and an extreme stratigist. and, like
all other samurai, he rose to th peak of his military career and also met
his downfall.
peace


----- Original Message -----
From: Michael Lorimer
Sent: Thursday, August 08, 2002 9:08 PM
To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [samuraihistory] favorite. samurai

Personally, my favourite samurai is Minamoto-no
Yoshitsune . Yoritomo his brother was clearly more
pragmatic and managed to consolidate the Kamakura
bakufu and appease the rival Buddhist sects, but
Yoshitsune appears to me to be a more rounded samurai;
a warrior of undoubted loyalty and took offence to all
who did doubt it, in the end dying for his belief in
himself .
Michael Lorimer


--- vicente gutierrez <alexelmaya@...> wrote:

<html><body>


<tt>
a, i was just wondering. what samurai do most people
prefere? oda nobunga, minamoto yoshiine or other?<BR>
<BR>

wrote:
> a, i was just wondering. what samurai do most people prefere? oda
nobunga, minamoto yoshiine or other?
